intro: Gonolobus pancololote, commonly known as the Pacific Island morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, edible berries that are sometimes used in traditional cuisines. Its leaves are often used in herbal remedies for their purported medicinal properties. The species thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing along coastal areas and in disturbed soils.
